definition: meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder

pinyin: yan3 zhong1 ding1 , rou4 zhong1 ci4

sentences.english: Consciousness is much more than the thorn, it is the dagger in the flesh.
sentences.chinese: 意识是比起肉中刺更为令人烦恼。

sentences.english: It is not surprising that they should seek to remove this thorn in their side.
sentences.chinese: 他们想拔掉这根肉中刺是不足为怪的。

sentences.english: Laden is the thorn in Bush's flesh.
That problem is a thorn in their flesh.
sentences.chinese: 例2那个问题是他们的肉中刺。

sentences.english: Cinderella is the thorn in her stepmother's flesh.
sentences.chinese: 灰姑娘是她后母的眼中钉肉中刺。

sentences.english: His friend has become a thorn in his side.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友已变成眼中钉肉中刺。

sentences.english: He had been a burr under the saddle of the government in his time.
sentences.chinese: 在他那时代，他一直是当局的眼中钉，肉中刺。

sentences.english: Transaction fees are a thorn in my side;
sentences.chinese: 手续费是肉中刺，监控费是项上刀。

definition: a thorn in one's eye/fig. a thorn in one's flesh
lit. calamity within one's bosom (idiom); major trouble hidden within
to hate sb to the bone (idiom)
to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
(of enemies) cannot live under the same sky/absolutely irreconcilable
to hate out of jealousy/to resent
feeling brambles and thorns in one's back (idiom)/uneasy and nervous/to be on pins and needles
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
